contentencoded:
Banks are open for the second day in Cyprus after two weeks of closure. From the outside, things appear to be calm. The President of Cyprus said this morning that the country will not leave the euro.

Marketplace's Stephen Beard joins Morning Report host Jeremy Hobson to discuss the mood on the island and how other countries in the region are reacting.
title: Cyprus calm but crisis effects ripple
teaser: Banks are open for the second day in Cyprus after two weeks of closure. From the outside, things appear to be calm. The President of Cyprus said this morning that the country will not leave the euro.
description: Banks are open for the second day in Cyprus after two weeks of closure. From the outside, things appear to be calm. The President of Cyprus said this morning that the country will not leave the euro.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, March 29, 2013
